snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will depart from traditional practice and forgo a ceremony in Albany, instead holding a pair of events in Manhattan and Buffalo.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo, who is set to begin his second term after turbulent but ultimately successful reelection year, hints that his second inaugural address will have national themes, which would be appropriate to a governor considering eventual presidential run.

byline.original: By JESSE McKINLEY and THOMAS KAPLAN
byline.contributor: Jesse McKinley reported from Albany, and Thomas Kaplan from New York.

lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo will depart from traditional practice and forgo a ceremony in Albany, instead holding a pair of events in Manhattan and Buffalo.

headline.main: Cuomo’s Second Inaugural Address Is Expected to Strike National Tone
headline.print_headline: In Second Inaugural Address, Cuomo Is Expected to Strike National Tone
